key_insight: UniCardio is a unified diffusion-transformer framework that generates and translates multimodal cardiovascular signals, enabling robust restoration of corrupted channels and real-time vital-sign estimation from heterogeneous inputs.
problem_solved: Addresses the lack of a single generative model that can reliably restore, translate between, and synthesize multiple cardiovascular signal modalities (e.g., ECG, PPG, PCG) under noise, missing channels, and real-time constraints.
method: A unified diffusion-based generative model with transformer temporal modeling to capture long-range dependencies across multimodal cardiovascular signals.

Conditional generation and cross-modal translation mechanisms that enable restoration of corrupted/missing channels and conversion between modalities, trained with multi-task losses that preserve clinical signal fidelity.
Optimized inference pipeline for low-latency sampling and incorporation of physiological constraints to support real-time vital-sign estimation and downstream abnormality detection.
impact: Provides ML practitioners a versatile tool for signal imputation, data augmentation, and cross-modal translation in clinical and wearable monitoring contexts, improving robustness of downstream diagnostics and enabling privacy-preserving synthetic datasets.

paper_title: Versatile cardiovascular signal generation with a unified diffusion transformer
